title: Birthplaces
name: Birthplaces
description:
A Map by Mountainmaverick

Different towns where different parts of my family came from.

properties.name: Dad's Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by Mountainmaverick  Miami, FloridaMy father and my aunt both were born and raised in Miami. They lived in Coral Gables for several years, too. My grandparents moved here from Kentucky during the first land boom of the late 20s. They lived in different parts of Kentucky, but the same general region, but they met here in Florida. Grandpa was a business and economics professor at the University of Miami and Grandma worked at the bookstore. My dad went to Miami after he transferred back home from attempting med school at Tulane. So yeah, I\'m a die hard Miami Hurricane to the bitter end. You might say We got some Canes over here, huh huh huh!

properties.name: Grandma Mac's Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by MountainmaverickAlexandria, KYThis is where my paternal grandmother was born. I originally thought that it was farther away from Cincinnati than it actually is. One of her relatives, either her father, uncle, or grandfather, I think ran a bus service from Alexandria to Newport, which is right across the river from Cincinnati, and that\'s where the Cambell County Courthouse is. Her father suffered from chronic resperatory illnesses, so he decided to move to Miami because he believed that the subtropical climate would help him to have a much better quality of life. Jobs were also easier to find down there than in the Cincinnati Tri-State area.

properties.name: Grandpa Mac's Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by MountainmaverickErlanger, KYThis is where my grandfather was from, most of his family lived in the Cincinnati area. He attended Georgetown College, which is close to Kentucky University. Not long after he graduated from college, he moved to Miami.

properties.name: Great-grandparents Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by MountainmaverickMilan, INWasn\'t Milan HS one of the teams from the movie Hoosiers? I don\'t know, it\'s been so long since I\'ve seen it. If I were from Indiana, I would have a shirt that would say "Hoosier Daddy." I\'m sure some fraternity in Bloomington already has them. Whatever, this is actually Bearcat country here anyway.

properties.name: Great-grandparents Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by MountainmaverickNorwood, OHNorwood is one of those cities that has been using its eminent domain authority to benefit private developers. Feel free to e-mail them to tell them that they suck.

properties.name: Maternal Grandparents Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by MountainmaverickColumbus, GABoth of my mother\'s parents plus a couple of my great-grandparents were born in Columbus. If I had to name one place in the country where I had the deepest roots, I\'d say Columbus even though I\'ve never lived there myself. Columbus is home to the largest infantry training base in the US, Fort Benning. Columbus is also the largest city in West Central Georgia. It was built at the head of navigation on the Chattahoochee River.

properties.name: My Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by Mountainmaverick417 Third Avenue, Albany, GAThis is where my uncle, who now lives in Kentucky, and my mother were born and raised. I was born here also, but my mom already lived in Atlanta at the time. She just wanted to go back home to have me so she could be in familiar surroundings. We moved back to Atlanta after things settled down. Dad\'s job was in Atlanta, so he stayed behind while my grandparents took care of my mom. My grandparents moved here from Columbus after WWII. Albany is the home of the late Ray Charles. It was devastated by a massive flooding of the Flint River in the mid-90s. Chehaw Park is one of the best zoos in the world. It was designed by local zoologist, Jack Hannah.
